com.jbion.utils.csv

Class CsvReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.csv.CsvReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TimestampedCsvReader

    public class CsvReader
extends Object
    A CsvReader is a basic reader for CSV files. Its current implementation contains a BufferedReader.
    Author:
    Joffrey BION

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CsvReader(String filename)
      Creates a CsvReader to read the specified file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this CsvReader.
      String[] readRow()
      Reads a row of the CSV file and returns it as an array containing a String for each column.
      String[] readRows(int nbRows)
      Reads several rows and returns the last one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CsvReader

        public CsvReader(String filename)
          throws FileNotFoundException,
                 Csv.NotACsvFileException
        Creates a CsvReader to read the specified file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Source filename.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the specified file is not found.
        Csv.NotACsvFileException - If the specified file is not a CSV file.

    • Method Detail

      • readRow

        public String[] readRow()
                 throws IOException
        Reads a row of the CSV file and returns it as an array containing a String for each column.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings, each String representing a cell in the read row, or null if the end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readRows(int)

      • readRows

        public String[] readRows(int nbRows)
                  throws IOException
        Reads several rows and returns the last one. This method behaves exactly as if readRow() was called nbRows times. Called with 0 as its argument, this method does not read any line, and returns the last line that was read by a previous call to readRow() or readRows(int). If the argument exceeds the number of lines in the file, the reader goes to the end of the file and null is returned.
        Parameters:
        nbRows - The number of rows to read.
        Returns:
        The last row that has been read, in the same format as readRow() would.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readRow()

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this CsvReader.
